metadata.title: CVE-2023-51796 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability in Ffmpeg v.N113007-g8d24a28d06 allows alocal attacker to execute arbitrary code via thelibavfilter/f_reverse.c:269:26 in areverse_request_frame.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-51796` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 6.1.1-4ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra - 6.1.1-4ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra60 - 6.1.1-4ubuntu2
libavcodec60 - 6.1.1-4ubuntu2
libavdevice60 - 6.1.1-4ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra - 6.1.1-4ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra9 - 6.1.1-4ubuntu2
libavfilter9 - 6.1.1-4ubuntu2
libavformat-extra - 6.1.1-4ubuntu2
libavformat-extra60 - 6.1.1-4ubuntu2
libavformat60 - 6.1.1-4ubuntu2
libavutil58 - 6.1.1-4ubuntu2
libpostproc57 - 6.1.1-4ubuntu2
libswresample4 - 6.1.1-4ubuntu2
libswscale7 - 6.1.1-4ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1.1-4ubuntu2').
